intro: Aphania angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aphania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Aphania angustifolia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
